channel.title: City of The Future
channel.description: Saw this on a commercial on adult swim, apparently a $1 billion dollar futuristic city is being built in New Mexico for testing purposes. This city will also have a population of 0, what are you thoughts on this? You can read up on it here, http://www.weather.com/news/ghost-town-scientific-20120512

item.title: City of The Future
item.dc:creator: @reyx7 reyx7
item.description:
@reyx7 wrote:

[quote=“Acorn_, post:9, topic:442789”][quote author=reyx7 link=topic=545476.msg3998566#msg3998566 date=1337629986]
They’ll probably shoot a missile at it and see if some sort of defense system properly deflects it or fires back. At the end, anyway. Self flushing toilets already exist as well, I can’t imagine how much change will be in here. Flying cars?
[/quote]
Eliminating cars completely from the drawing board, there will be a whole new transportation system apparently.
Also they said the only kind of testing they’d wouldn’t be doing is destructive testing.
I’m assuming everything is going to be electronic, even doors.[/quote]
The sliding door already exists. I bet they’re going to use it to test the mass use of small cameras and microphones. Big Brother is watching.

Read full topic

item.title: City of The Future
item.dc:creator: @Acorn1 Acorn_
item.description:
@Acorn1 wrote:

reyx7:

They’ll probably shoot a missile at it and see if some sort of defense system properly deflects it or fires back. At the end, anyway. Self flushing toilets already exist as well, I can’t imagine how much change will be in here. Flying cars?

Eliminating cars completely from the drawing board, there will be a whole new transportation system apparently.
Also they said the only kind of testing they’d wouldn’t be doing is destructive testing.
I’m assuming everything is going to be electronic, even doors.

Read full topic

item.title: City of The Future
item.dc:creator: @whackatre Whackatre
item.description:
@whackatre wrote:

Quoting a comment made by Mike Sweitzer in response to that article, which I partially agree with:

this is so dumb... I wonder how homeless people feel about this... biggest waste of a billion $ ever.. this is what innovative thinkers are for.. being able to envision , in ones mind, how all those things without wasting a billions of dollars on models that can be observed... how bout instead we dedicate all that infrastructure to the homeless and THINK about ways to improve then actually make them happen, rather than waste billions of $$ on pretending.

Read full topic

item.title: City of The Future
item.dc:creator: @Xellium Xellium
item.description:
@Xellium wrote:

The main restriction on scientific development is people. I support this.

Read full topic
